name: HD 81817
scenarioDescription:
The HD 81817 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 81817 is a star with 4.3 times the mass of the Sun, and 83.8 times its radius. It is located 877.26 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.15 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 81817 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 81817 system


HD 81817 b

HD 81817 b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.30 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 81817 b is 8617.800000000001 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 81817 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 81817, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
